actor_awards.notes: Won a Tony Award for Best Actor in a Musical for 'Take Me Along' (1960). His Oscar nomination was for Best Supporting Actor in 'The Hustler'. Known as 'The Great One' and for his legendary TV series 'The Honeymooners'.

filmography.title: The Hustler
filmography.role_description: The legendary, dapper pool shark who faces off against the ambitious upstart Fast Eddie Felson in a high-stakes marathon match.
filmography.plot: An up-and-coming pool player plays a high-stakes game against the long-time champion but eventually loses all his money, leading to a journey of self-discovery.

filmography.title: Smokey and the Bandit
filmography.role_description: A foul-mouthed, determined Texas lawman who pursues the Bandit across state lines after his son is left at the altar.
filmography.plot: The Bandit is hired on to run a tractor-trailer full of beer over county lines in hot pursuit by a pesky sheriff.

filmography.title: Requiem for a Heavyweight
filmography.role_description: The cynical and desperate manager of an aging boxer who is pressured by the mob to exploit his fighter.
filmography.plot: A knockout ends the career of a heavyweight boxer, and his manager and trainer try to find him a new job while dealing with their own debts.
filmography.awards: Laurel Award: Nomination – Top Male Supporting Performance

filmography.title: Gigot
filmography.role_description: A mute, kind-hearted janitor in Paris who befriends a prostitute and her daughter. Gleason also wrote the story and music.
filmography.plot: A mute Frenchman befriends the little daughter of a prostitute, but his simple life is complicated by the cruelty of others.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Drama

filmography.title: Soldier in the Rain
filmography.role_description: A clever and comfortable career supply sergeant who mentors a younger soldier played by Steve McQueen.
filmography.plot: A worldly Army Master Sergeant and his naive worshiper get into a series of misadventures.

filmography.title: Nothing in Common
filmography.role_description: The acerbic, estranged father of a successful ad executive who must reconnect with his son as his health fails.
filmography.plot: A successful advertising executive must care for his aging father after his mother leaves him, forcing them to confront their strained relationship.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Smokey and the Bandit II
filmography.role: Sheriff Buford T. Justice / Gaylord Justice / Reginald Van Justice
filmography.role_description: Gleason returns as the relentless sheriff and also plays two of his brothers in this sequel.
filmography.plot: The Bandit goes on another cross-country run, transporting an elephant to the Republican National Convention, with Sheriff Justice still on his tail.

filmography.title: The Toy
filmography.role_description: A wealthy but distant businessman who buys a man to be a living toy for his spoiled son.
filmography.plot: An unemployed journalist is hired by a wealthy businessman to be a toy for his spoilt son.

filmography.title: Papa's Delicate Condition
filmography.role_description: A tippling railroad supervisor who impulsively buys a circus to please his daughter.
filmography.plot: A man's drinking habits cause trouble for his family, but his love for his daughter leads him to make grand gestures.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('Call Me Irresponsible')

filmography.title: Smokey and the Bandit Part 3
filmography.role_description: Justice takes center stage in this third installment as he races against the Bandit (now played by Jerry Reed) to transport a replica shark.
filmography.plot: Sheriff Buford T. Justice is ready to retire when he takes a wager to transport a large fish from Miami to Texas.
filmography.awards: Razzie Award: Nomination – Worst Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Sting II
filmography.role_description: Gleason steps into the role of the veteran con man originally played by Paul Newman, teaming up for a new heist.
filmography.plot: A group of con men team up to pull off a scam against a racketeer and a gangster.

filmography.title: Don't Drink the Water
filmography.role_description: An American caterer whose family is accused of spying behind the Iron Curtain.
filmography.plot: An American family on vacation is hijacked to a communist country and must take refuge in the American embassy.

filmography.title: How to Commit Marriage
filmography.role_description: A cynical record producer who becomes involved in the marital squabbles of a straight-laced couple.
filmography.plot: A couple plans to divorce, but their daughter's engagement to the son of a cynical promoter complicates matters.

filmography.title: Skidoo
filmography.role_description: A retired hitman who is forced by a mob boss to infiltrate a prison to kill an informant in this psychedelic cult film.
filmography.plot: A retired mobster is forced back into duty to kill a squealer who is being held in a high-security prison.

filmography.title: All Through the Night
filmography.role_description: A member of a gambler's circle who helps uncover a Nazi spy ring in New York.
filmography.plot: Gangsters track down a fifth-columnist ring after the baker of their favorite cheesecake is murdered.

filmography.title: Larceny, Inc.
filmography.role_description: A small role as a soda jerk in this gangster comedy starring Edward G. Robinson.
filmography.plot: Three ex-convicts buy a luggage shop next to a bank, planning to tunnel into the vault, but business turns out to be surprisingly good.

filmography.title: Orchestra Wives
filmography.role_description: The bass player in the Glenn Miller Orchestra who provides comic relief amidst the band's romantic dramas.
filmography.plot: A young woman marries a trumpet player in a famous swing band and learns about the difficulties of life on the road.

filmography.title: Springtime in the Rockies
filmography.role_description: The agent to the lead character, trying to manage his client's career and drinking.
filmography.plot: A Broadway show's partners have a falling out, leading to a romantic pursuit at a Canadian resort.

filmography.title: Navy Blues
filmography.role_description: A sailor involved in schemes to win a gunnery contest. Gleason's film debut.
filmography.plot: Two sailors try to raise money by betting on a gunnery contest, only to find their marksman is leaving the service.

filmography.title: Lady Gangster
filmography.role_description: A mobster involved in a bank robbery scheme.
filmography.plot: An actress is used as a pawn in a bank robbery and sent to prison, where she tries to clear her name.

filmography.title: The Desert Hawk
filmography.role_description: A comic sidekick role in this Arabian Nights adventure.
filmography.plot: An Arabian blacksmith fights to protect his people from a tyrannical prince and win the heart of a princess.

filmography.title: Tramp, Tramp, Tramp
filmography.role_description: One of two barbers who are rejected from the army and try to form a home defense unit.
filmography.plot: Two barbers try to join the army but are rejected, so they form their own home defense unit.

filmography.title: Escape from Crime
filmography.role_description: A convict friend of the protagonist who helps him after release.
filmography.plot: A convict is released from prison and becomes a daredevil photographer.

filmography.title: Steel Against the Sky
filmography.role_description: A drunk in a diner (uncredited or minor role) in this drama about bridge builders.
filmography.plot: Three brothers who are bridge builders compete for the affections of the same woman.

filmography.title: Izzy and Moe
filmography.role_description: A prohibition agent who uses disguises to catch bootleggers, paired with his partner Moe Smith (Art Carney). (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Two vaudeville performers become prohibition agents and use their makeup skills to raid speakeasies.

filmography.title: Mr. Halpern and Mr. Johnson
filmography.role_description: A man who meets the husband of his former lover at her funeral, leading to a conversation about the past. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Two elderly men meet at a funeral and discover they shared a love for the same woman.
filmography.awards: CableACE Award: Win – Actor in a Dramatic or Theatrical Program
